titleStmt.title: John Hunt account book, 1769-1774: Electronic Version
titleStmt.editor: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

publicationStmt.publisher: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College .

title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

profileDesc.creation: Original written 21st day 5th month 1769-27th day 11th month 1774

row.cell: To 2 days & a half by William
To work at the kitchen myself 4 days
Abraham Matlack's come in all to
To making an apple mill beam and work at the sides trough myself & Thomas Bishop
Myself 2 days making a wheel for the grindstone
John 2 days Josiah 2 days William half a day reaping
John half a day cutting a door in barn
John half a day at the smokehouse & sundries
Myself 3 days & a half at screw press
To 1 myself Josiah 1 day Bill 1 day keeping
To half a day myself shingling
By a lock for a chest & a quart of oil
By a quarter of beef comes to
By a quarter of beef comes to
By half a bushel and a peck of buckwheat
Then balanced accounts with Kendall Coles & there was due to me
To 1 day's work at the pump
Josiah 1 day putting in a cart tongue
Josiah 2 days making a wagon tongue and a stock sled
To half a day myself laying out cellar & such
Then begun to work at Job's house myself 3 days
Went twice to lay out the cellar
To getting timber for his barn
Myself 1 day and a piece shingling
By 10lb of tallows & a quart vinegar
By half a gallon of vinegar
By half a gallon of vinegar
By half a gallon of vinegar
By a gallon of molasses brought from town
A few small nails I brought from the new house
By a dozen pounds of soap fat
By a dye pot Susannah brought from town
By a gallon & a half of vinegar
By tallow pot brought from Cole's
By 1 gallon & a half of vinegar & 7 feet of cedar board
By 6 pounds of beef at 4Â½d Susannah brought from town
By a peck of red potatoes @ 1s worth of Boraks
By half a dozen of perch
By cash when Susannah and I went to town
By a half a quarter of beef weighed 98lb at 3d/lb
To 1 day's work by Josiah making garden
Josiah 4 days making a little house
To cutting down timber 3 of us 1 day apiece
To work at the hay house myself 4 days half
Josiah 2 days finish off the hay house
To 2 days work at the stable making a rack
To work at the new house
Then begun to work at Coles' house again, myself 4Â½ days
Josiah 3 days making bedstead & mending swill trough &c.
John Morton debitor to one day's work and a half by Josiah making windowcases
Then begun to work for John Stokes
To work done at home myself 3Â½ days
Josiah 5 days & a half at paint house & making a swill trough &c.
Josiah 3 days at the house finished the sink
Myself 2 days & a piece til 10 o'clock

Josiah d2s6 per day 3 day & a half making a shoemaker seat & at work at the window shutters and cellar doors putting a swordLikely a technical term for a part of a wagon or other device, rather than a weapon. Compare sense 5.a of the Oxford English Dictionary entry for sword. in the big wagon &c.
Myself 3 days & a half (one of these 3 I was trimming casks)
Josiah 5 days made an apple mill sweep this week
Went this 5th day morning set 6 hoops
Myself 4 days & a half put in a block tongue Â½ ditto
William 6 days Wml B one day at wheelbarrow
Myself half a day laying out work for the boy
Then begun to work for Joseph Worington. Getting timber, Myself 2 days & a half
Myself 1 piece a day laying the barn floor
Myself 1 day pulling down the lean-to
Went down after meeting to look at tree for apple mill
Went to make the apple mill
To a coffin for the child
Josiah 1 day putting up the partition
By 3 bushels & a half of wheat & 2 bushels of rye by cash
Then balanced accounts with Samuel Collins and there was due to me
To work at draper shop myself 2 days
To an oak board 23in wide & 14ft long
To one day's work by William
To a low bedstead for Rachel
To making a pump for Rachel Champion 19 long
By setting a pair of new shoes
To work work at the new house myself 4Â½ days
Myself 1 day and a piece the time the beef was brought home John Lippincott
Myself 4 days (allowed Â½ a day for cold weather)
Myself half a day putting in glass
Josiah 5 days & a half alone this week at 2s6 per day
(Josiah made the wagon sides this week)
William 5 days at 2s per day alone this week
To turning 3 sets of dough trough legs
To turning 2 sets of table legs
To turning a set of low bedsteads
By 11lb of tallow at 7d per pound
By 2 bushels & a half of wheat
By half a bushel of Indian corn
Then reckoned with Robert Hunt and there was due to him
To 2 days myself one day putting in glass and one day at work at little tables
Josiah 3 days making bedsteads & putting in glass
William 5 days he was 2 days at bedsteads
To turning 3 sets of low bedsteads
To turning a set of table legs for Job
William 6 days making a new gate finishing a bedstead and & mending board fence
Josiah 6 days at work at the facing upstairs & spouts
Josiah 5 days at facing & garret floor
Josiah 6 days at garret floor & putting out spouts and some work at the old house
To making a pump 56 feet & a half long at 1s6 per foot & 5s for the boxes
To one day's work by William
By 2lb of wool at 1s6 per lb
By money he paid Joseph Hewlings on my account
To 2 days work myself at his screw press
Myself 1 day Josiah 1 day & Bill 1 day
Then begun to hew timber for John Lippincott's barn. Myself 3Â½ days
William 2 days (the time they made the harrows)
John 2 days (they were there all the week from second day, a snowy time)
Bill 1Â½ day (went from meeting to make the cart body)
Myself 4 days & a half (throwed of the half day)
William Buzby 6 days moving the old barn this week
By cash received of John Lippincott
By cash borrowed of John Lippincott
By cash paid on act of subscription for Sewel's History
William went to John Lippincott's to work 1Â½ day
Myself 2 days laying barn floor & sundry
To making a pump 15Â½ feet long, boxes & so forth 7s6
Then balanced accounts with John Lippincott. Due me:
To putting a piece to the pump 16 feet long
To 7 days work by John along with Josiah Weaver
By pig that was forgot when we settled
To half a day's work myself
Myself part of a day trimming casks
Myself 1 day at work at the calf's house
Then reckoned accounts with Kendall Coles, and there remains due to me
John & William 1 day weatherboarding the old barn
To making a pump 33 feet long
To making of sash cellar doors, laying the platform round the pump, and sundry other little matters about house
By 2 bushels of wheat at 6s9 per bushel
By 2 bushels of wheat very ordinary cleaned
Kendall Coles creditor by 1 bushel of Indian corn
Myself half a day we raised the house
To 1 day's work myself mending the cider press &c.
Then balanced accounts with Caleb Evans and there was due to him
David Davis creditor to 2 gallons of vinegar
Then begun to work at the meeting house at Ancocas making the door & windowcases
William Buzby went over the creek again to work 4 days
I went over the creek to work again myself 5Â½ days

cell.date: Dated last of the 2nd week 23 of the 8mo

table.head: At work at the meeting house

body.p: They shall go to Confusion together that are makers of idols. XIV of Isiah 16

p.quote: Their idols were upon the beasts and upon their cattle: your carriages were heavy laden; they were a burden to the weary beasts.
Harken unto me ye stout hearted that are far from righteousness

body.p: See Ezekiel IX:4 and the Lord said unto him go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and set a mark upon the foreheads of the men that sigh and that cry for all the abominations that be done in the midst thereof.

They who are single to the truth, waiting daily to feel the life and virtue of it in their hearts, these shall rejoice in the midst of adversity: these shall not have their hearts moved with fear, nor tossed with anguish because of evil tidings. Psalms CXII:7-8
Sewel's History pages 82 & 83 are remarkable passages concerning a man's beating Miles Halhead & Miles's wife being discontented.

Psalms CI, 7th verse he that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that telleth lies, shall not tarry in my sight, & I will early destroy all the wicked of the land that I may cut off all wicked doers from the city of the Lord.
Compare Deuteronomy XVIII 22 verse with Jeremiah XXVIII & 9 verse. Moses' song Deuteronomy 32 chapter, Hannah's Song 1st Samuel II chapter
Compare Daniel VI: 24 verse with the V of Ruth & 9 verse concerning Mordecai & Haman & Daniel & them that cast him into the lion's den
and Mordecai came again to the King's gate after he had been advanced. 6th Esther 12 verse
Esther: V Ch.: he sat at the king's gate.
Daniel sat in the gate of the king. See IInd of Daniel 49 verse.
So Jonah went out of the city and sat on the east side of the city. IV of Jonah 5 verse

row.cell: Then went to John Stones to hew timber for his barn. Worked but about 2 hours and it rained and let us off, myself & John
Went to framing John was there all the week 6 days
John went again to lay the floor & make the doors John 6 day
Myself 1 day hanging door & about a plow
Went to hewing timber for the kitchen myself 3 days
John went again was there all the week alone
John 6 days went down, weather was a hindrance
By 2 bushels & a half of rye at 3s9 per bushel
Myself 4 days raised the kitchen this week
